units.title: Aggregate formation (Day -1)
units.text: 2 × 105 cells per mL on 6-well low-attachment plate 50 μM Y27632
units.rationale: Establishes the initial cell density and Y‑27632 to promote aggregate formation.

units.title: Mesoderm induction (Day 0)
units.rationale: Activates WNT signaling and BMP4 to drive hPSCs toward mesoderm.

units.title: Vascular differentiation induction (Day 3)
units.rationale: Stimulates endothelial and pericyte lineage commitment.

units.title: Embedding aggregates in collagen I–Matrigel (Day 5)
units.rationale: Provides growth factors and serum to support sprouting in a 3D matrix.

units.title: Extract blood vessel networks (Day 10)
units.text: vessel organoid self-assembly (12-well plate) ~20 min for 1 well (~50–60 organoids)
units.rationale: Isolates individual vascular networks for downstream analysis or culture.

units.title: Transplant organoids into NSG mice (Day 15)
units.text: Transplant into immuno Box 1 (96-well plate) compromised (NSG) mice
units.rationale: Introduces organoids in vivo to assess functional integration.

units.title: Resuspend cells in aggregation medium
units.text: Resuspend the cells in 5 mL of aggregation medium using a 5-mL serological pipette and collect the cells in a 15-mL Falcon tube.
units.rationale: Prepares a uniform cell suspension for aggregate formation.

units.title: Plate cell suspension for aggregate formation
units.text: Place 3 mL of cell suspension per well into a 6-well low-attachment plate and incubate for 1 d until cell aggregates with smooth borders (>50- to 100-µm diameter) have been formed (Fig. 2b).
units.rationale: Allows cells to self‑assemble into size‑controlled aggregates.

units.title: Add prewarmed medium for vascular differentiation
units.text: Add prewarmed (37 °C) StemPro-34 SFM complete medium including 15% FBS, 100 ng/mL VEGF-A and 100 ng/mL FGF-2 to induce blood vessel differentiation.
units.rationale: Supplies necessary factors to promote vessel sprouting after embedding.

units.title: Transplant organoids into kidney capsule
units.text: Transplant blood vessel organoids into the kidney capsule of immunocompromised mice as previously described37. When transplanting, use one blood vessel organoid per kidney and transplant the entire blood vessel organoid (Fig. 4a).
units.rationale: Tests organoid functionality in a physiological niche.
